data.enText: staying with or supporting a particular person, organization or belief

data.chText: 忠实的仆人 / 朋友 / 狗
他对党的理想坚贞不移。
data.enText: He remained faithful to the ideals of the party.

data.chText: 她为公司忠诚服务了40年，因而获得奖赏。
data.enText: She was rewarded for her 40 years' faithful service with the company.

data.chText: 我是贵报多年来的忠实读者。
data.enText: I have been a faithful reader of your newspaper for many years.

data.chText: （宗教的）忠实信徒；（政党的）忠诚支持者
data.enText: people who believe in a religion; the loyal supporters of a political party

data.chText: 总统将继续获得忠诚党员的拥护。
data.enText: The president will keep the support of the party faithful .

before.enText: of a wife, husband or partner

data.enText: not having a sexual relationship with anyone else
true and accurate; not changing anything

data.chText: 精确的副本；如实的叙述 / 描述
他的译文做到了忠于原文的精神。
data.enText: His translation manages to be faithful to the spirit of the original.
able to be trusted; that you can rely on
She had doubts about his faithfulness.

ex.chText: 鲍勃一直是我们家忠诚的朋友。
ex.enText: Bob has always been a faithful friend of our family.

ex.chText: 他是一个忠于自己原则的人。
ex.enText: He is a man who always remains faithful to his principles.
After their marriage, she was faithful to her husband.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人、政党、信念等忠诚的，通常作定语；也指在爱情上忠贞不二的。

ex.chText: 尽管政府受到指责，他依然效忠于它。
ex.enText: He remains loyal to the government despite criticism against it.

ex.chText: 她全家人都是湖人队的忠实球迷。
ex.enText: Her whole family were loyal supporters of the Lakers.

synonyms.bx: 指忠于朋友、国家、原则等并一直对其加以支持的。

ex.chText: 他是一位可以信赖的朋友。
他们需要一个可靠的办法来降低离婚率。
ex.enText: They need a reliable method to decrease the divorce rate.

synonyms.bx: 指某人或某事物可以信赖、依靠的。

ex.chText: 他过去常骑着他那辆忠心耿耿的自行车去见女朋友。
ex.enText: He used to ride his trusty bike to meet his girlfriend.

ex.chText: 她把她那条忠实的狗带在身边。
ex.enText: She had her trusty dog with her.

synonyms.bx: 指武器、车辆、宠物等长期以来一直可以信赖的，通常作定语，常为幽默用法。

tr: a group of people who adhere to a common faith and habitually attend a given church
marked by fidelity to an original
example: a faithful copy of the portrait
a faithful rendering of the observed facts
we do not doubt that England has a faithful patriot in the Lord Chancellor

tr: not having sexual relations with anyone except your husband or wife, or your boyfriend or girlfriend
example: he remained faithful to his wife

value.def: Someone who is faithful to a person, organization, idea, or activity remains firm in their belief in them or support for them.

example.ex: She had been faithful to her promise to guard this secret...
example.tran: 她一直信守承诺，保守着这个秘密。

example.ex: Older Americans are among this country's most faithful voters.
example.tran: 较年长的美国人是这个国家最忠实的选民群体之一。

posc.def: The faithful are people who are faithful to someone or something.

example.ex: He spends his time making speeches at factories or gatherings of the Party faithful.
example.tran: 他花时间在工厂或该党的忠实拥护者的集会上发表演说。

value.tran: 忠实的;忠诚的;忠贞不渝的

example.ex: He has since 1965 faithfully followed and supported every twist and turn of government policy.
example.tran: 自1965年以来，他一直忠诚地跟随和支持政府政策的每一次变化和转向。

value.def: Someone who is faithful to their husband, wife, or lover does not have a sexual relationship with anyone else.

example.ex: She insisted that she had remained faithful to her husband...
example.tran: 她坚持说自己对丈夫一直是忠诚的。

example.ex: I'm very faithful when I love someone.
example.tran: 我爱一个人是会非常忠贞的。

value.tran: (对丈夫、妻子或恋人)忠诚的，忠贞的

value.def: The faithful are the group of people who believe in a particular religion.

example.ex: The faithful revered him then as a prophet.
example.tran: 那时，信徒们尊他为先知。

value.def: A faithful account, translation, or copy of something represents or reproduces the original accurately.

example.ex: Colin Welland's screenplay is faithful to the novel.
example.tran: 科林·韦兰的电影剧本忠实于原小说。

example.ex: ...faithful copies of household items used in the mid-1800s.
example.tran: 19世纪中期家庭用品的逼真仿制品

value.tran: (叙述、翻译或抄本)如实的，忠实原文的

example.ex: When I adapt something I translate from one meaning to another as faithfully as I can.
example.tran: 我改编东西的时候，会尽可能忠实地将意思表达出来。

value.def: You can refer to something that has been used or has existed for a long time as an old faithful, especially when it is something you can rely on.

example.ex: We tested a selection of vacuum cleaners, from old faithfuls to those with the latest features.
example.tran: 我们测试了各种真空吸尘器，从值得信赖的老牌子到有着最新特色的产品，不一而足。

value.tran: (尤指值得信赖的)旧有物品，老牌产品
